alert.note: Alert for Northern Lake County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Warning issued October 28 at 4:46AM PDT until October 28 at 10:00AM PDT by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PDT THIS MORNING... ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 1 PM PDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 32. For the Wind Advisory, northeast winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 45 mph expected. * WHERE...Northern Lake County. * WHEN...For the Freeze Warning, until 10 AM PDT this morning. For the Wind Advisory, from 5 PM this afternoon to 1 PM PDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops and other sensitive vegetation.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. Provide adequate shelter for outdoor pets or consider bringing them indoors. Frost Advisories and Freeze Warnings are issued during the local growing season as defined by climatology and local agriculture experts. Once the growing season has ended these statements will no longer be issued until the spring.
